messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Wild dogs live in Moscow. This is interesting.
About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there.
Some dogs were born wild.
Other dogs were pets. Their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They saw the dogs learned to live very well in the city.
They learned it is more safe to cross the street with people.
Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

metadata.feedback_text: FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7199 is below the required 0.75. This indicates a significant loss of the original text's core message and nuance. While the individual facts are present, the emphasis on the 'remarkably successful adaptation' of the dogs to urban life is diluted. The original text conveys a stronger sense of their unique and impressive adaptation, which is weakened by phrases like 'learned to live very well' in the simplified version. The choppy sentence structure also fragments the narrative, reducing the overall coherence and impact of the original message. Suggestion: Rephrase sentences to better convey the degree of success and adaptation, ensuring the core message of the dogs' remarkable urban survival is fully preserved.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Wild dogs live in Moscow. This is interesting.
About 35,000 wild dogs live on the streets there.
Some dogs were born wild.
Other dogs were pets. Their owners left them.
Some dogs live alone. Other dogs live in groups.
In 2010, scientists studied the dogs.
They saw the dogs learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.
The dogs learned it is safer to cross the street with people.
Some dogs seem to understand traffic lights.

metadata.feedback_text: PASS: The text successfully meets all A2 readability requirements. It maintains factual integrity, preserves the core meaning, and adheres to the specified CEFR level. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7918 and BERTScore of 0.9297 are well within the acceptable range. The CEFR classifier correctly identified the text as A2. Vocabulary is consistently at the A1/A2 level, with no detected B1 or higher words. Sentence structures are short and simple, avoiding complex clauses or advanced connectors. The simplification of 'adapted remarkably successfully to urban life' to 'learned to live in the city very well. This was a big success.' is an excellent example of A2-level rephrasing.
